Overwatch 2 disappoints with minimal innovation. Stagnant gameplay and outdated graphics fail to justify a sequel. Lacks fresh mechanics to invigorate the experience. Disconnection from player feedback hampers potential. Overall, a lackluster follow-up.

Blizzard, I fuck your mother with an old mother. I fucking pushed her. You fucking don't treat China players as people, do you? I'm your 18th generation ancestor, fuck you. What did you say about the data of the previous account? Your mother forced me to say no, and it was gone. Later, you must have thought that the money of players in China could not earn your mlgb, and then you played the simplified Chinese. You son of a bitch, why don't you die? I'm looking forward to your death. Damn it, I gave you this bad review, and I gave it to you in a different number. I'll give you a bad review if it's a big deal, but do you have anything to match? I feel bad about spending money on you, fuck you blizzard and fuck you Bobby Kotick

[h1] Lets get to the point, the number "2" on the title is a joke. [/h1]

[b] For my take and story: [/b]
I joined this game around its 2nd Halloween event and played for 3 years straight.
It was a fun time, before the game started to focus on their [i] "competitive" [/i] side, if you can even call it that.
My break point was around when Role Queue and Echo got Released and i hardly found any point playing the game.

[b] Now? [/b]
Well what can i say, glad i paid 60 bucks just for it to come to this, an irrelevant sequel just so they could turn it into a F2P crashgrab. All the promises they made just to met us with this. At least in OW 1 there was a drive to max out playtime as much as possible in events to get as much lootboxes as possible and have the best chance of getting the skin you wanted- Now its reduced to nothing. [strike] Don't even get me started on paying 15$ for what left over of the pve mode (and on skin prices) so you can get 2 hours of playtime. [/strike]

[b] Yeah thanks Blizzard, how did u manage to fuck this one up so badly? [/b]

Remember when just playing matches [strike] (and tanks when role queue become a thing) [/strike] you can get loot boxes weekly and have a chance of getting a cool skin or credits to save up for events? Yeah now have less of that and 25 credits instead of loot boxes [strike] (2000 is a legendary skin btw) [/strike]

[u] But to give some good points, gameplay is still decent, that haven't realy changed much. [/u]

My rating:
OW1 - 8/10
OW2 - 4/10

That was my rant, don't use money on this game.

Bye.

Bravi, sfogatevi. Recensite il gioco nel miglior modo possibile scrivendo il nulla  cosmico e qualche battuti a da ragazzini di seconda media.

Ecco la mia recensione:
Il titolo non ha mai stancato sin dalla beta del 2016.
Si nota da parte di blizzard il faticoso impegno di bilanciare gli eroi anche se non riuscendo bene, anche essendo il loro primo fps eil lato negativo di ascoltare sempre la community per alcuni cambi.
Mi sono affezionato molto al primo titolo di overwatch anche per il merito di premiare il giocatore con skin sbloccabili senza versare nemmeno un euro. Peccato che tutto questo sia cambiato con overwatch 2 e la direzione che ha imposto il ceo per massimizzare i profitti su un titolo che non veniva piÃ¹ finanziato.
A parte le promesse non mantenute e prendendoci per i fondelli si prima dellâ€™uscita del gioco. Ritengo che il gioco in se ha unâ€™ottima giocabilitÃ  che non stanca senza versare neanche un euro. Che ne strillino i giocatori di tf2 o haters incalliti.

Buon game a tutti e siate positivi invece di essere cosÃ¬ idioti
